oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dayton Rosenwald School: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of one-story building laid out on a 7-teacher plan . The center structure would have been an auditorium with three classrooms on both sides. The auditorium features a green side gable roof with three casement windows with three double transoms flanked by two single transoms. The green front gable roof extensions also feature their own entrance and casement window.

The Dayton Rosenwald School was built with support of the Julius Rosenwald Fund. The local community also contributed to the school's funding. The Fisk Rosenwald database lists one of the first budget years as 1928-29. As a seven-teacher type school, it was one of the larger Rosenwald schools built.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee
